channel.title: Graphics Card Update?
channel.description:
How do I update my graphics card? My graphics card is Intel, and how do I update it? The last time my graphics card was updated was 2004.
The website where I went to update it was at [url=http://support.intel.com/support/graphics/]http://support.intel.com/support/graphics/[/url] But it's too confusing! Please help.

item.title: Graphics Card Update?
item.dc:creator: @Yoshi0308 Yoshi0308
item.description:
@Yoshi0308 wrote:

[quote=“Schizzo, post:5, topic:145106”]Here’s the one you need, I think:

Drivers & Software

Downloads for Graphics Drivers for Intel® 82815 Graphics Controller

Download new and previously released drivers including support software, bios, utilities, firmware and patches for Intel products.

Select what operating system you have, click on the first driver (number 1), click “Download”, and then click the text; the download should start in a few seconds.[/quote]

Thanks.

Read full topic

item.title: Graphics Card Update?
item.dc:creator: @Schizzo Schizzo
item.description:
@Schizzo wrote:

Here’s the one you need, I think:

Drivers & Software

Downloads for Graphics Drivers for Intel® 82815 Graphics Controller

Download new and previously released drivers including support software, bios, utilities, firmware and patches for Intel products.

Select what operating system you have, click on the first driver (number 1), click “Download”, and then click the text; the download should start in a few seconds.

Read full topic

item.title: Graphics Card Update?
item.dc:creator: @Yoshi0308 Yoshi0308
item.description:
@Yoshi0308 wrote:

[quote=“Schizzo, post:3, topic:145106”]I’m pretty sure he means his drivers.

Yoshi, you need to know the name of you graphics card if you want to find the updated drivers. To find out what card you have go to your Start Menu -> Run -> type “dxdiag”. In the window that pops up, click on the tab named “Display”. Where is says name, type exactly what it says and post it here.[/quote]

Okay, I’ll just put everything it says.

---Device-------

Name: Intel® 82815 Graphics Controller (Microsoft
Manufacturer: Intel Corporation
Chip Type: Intel® Corporation
DAC Type: Internal
Approx. Total Memory: 32.0 MB
Current Display Mode: 1024 x 768 (24 bit) (60Hz)
Monitor: Gateway EV700B (Yeah, my computer is old.)

—Drivers-------

Main Driver: i81xdnt5.dll
Version: 6.13.0001.3198 (English)
Date: 8/4/2004 03:56:42
WHQL Logo’d: Yes
Mini VDD: i81xnt5.sys
VDD: n/a
DDI Version: 8

Read full topic

item.title: Graphics Card Update?
item.dc:creator: @Schizzo Schizzo
item.description:
@Schizzo wrote:

I’m pretty sure he means his drivers.

Yoshi, you need to know the name of you graphics card if you want to find the updated drivers. To find out what card you have go to your Start Menu -> Run -> type “dxdiag”. In the window that pops up, click on the tab named “Display”. Where is says name, type exactly what it says and post it here.

Read full topic

item.title: Graphics Card Update?
item.dc:creator: @Exception Exception
item.description:
@Exception wrote:

Are you trying to upgrade your actual graphics card hardware (The component inside your computer case), or your graphics drivers, the program that makes your graphics card work?

Read full topic
